newsitem.title: JAPAN: Toshiba launches business desktop PCs in Europe.
newsitem.headline: Toshiba launches business desktop PCs in Europe.

text.p: Toshiba Corp said on Tuesday it had started marketing desktop personal computers (PCs) for business use in Britain, Germany, and France.
The move is part of the company's reinforcement of its worldwide PC business, it said in a statement.
Toshiba plans to ship four million units of PCs worldwide in the year to next March 31, up 2.7 million units from 1996/97.
"The company is strengthening its capabilities as a global PC supplier," it said.

"In this connection, it is promoting its international desktop business, still the largest segment of the global PC market, and further strengthening its leadership position in the worldwide notebook PC market," it said.
Toshiba sells its Equium business PC series in Britain, Germany and France, it said.
"The company will now build on its new presence in Europe's three largest markets for business computers," it said.
A Toshiba spokesman did not give any prices for the Equium models in the three countries.
He said Toshiba would introduce the business desktop PC series in other European markets in the future but he did not provide specific dates.
Toshiba expects to sell 90,000 of the computers in Europe by the end of March 1998, the spokesman said.
The company introduced its home-use desktop Infinia PC series in France in March but it has no immediate plan to launch the series in other European markets, he said.
Toshiba also started selling the Equium series in the United States in March with an annual target of 400,000 to 500,000 units, the spokesman said.
Toshiba also sells the Infinia in the United States.
Toshiba also announced that it had launched eight new portable PCs worldwide on Tuesday, and had started worldwide marketing of its mini-notebook Libretto50CT.
Previously, the Libretto50CT was available only in Japan.
Toshiba expects to sell 100,000 Librettos in the United States, 50,000 in Europe and 35,000 in Asia, excluding Japan, by the end of March 1998, the Toshiba spokesman said.
Toshiba also said that it would start marketing an upgraded multimedia desktop PC in Japan on June 10.
Toshiba has the largest share of the world laptop market.
